intro: Acidanthera pallida, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and striking plant native to South Africa. It is a terrestrial orchid with delicate, pale pink or white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a unique appearance, with long, narrow leaves and a single, showy flower that resembles a ghostly figure. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and requires specific environmental conditions to flourish. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
